member.name: T:telegen.Agents.Interfaces.IAgent
member.summary: Generic agent interface used by the scripting engine.

member.name: M:telegen.Agents.Interfaces.IAgent.Execute(telegen.Operations.Operation)
member.summary: Executes the specified operation and returns the result.
member.param: The operation... a description of the action that needs to happen.
member.returns: The results of the operation, or null if no action was taken.

member.name: T:telegen.IScriptEngine
member.summary: Describes the interface for the script engine.

member.name: M:telegen.IScriptEngine.Execute(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the script contained in the specified filename.
member.remarks: Most implementations of this command will read the contents of the file into a string array, and then forward them to the method.
member.returns: A list of returned by the script.

member.name: M:telegen.IScriptEngine.Execute(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{telegen.Operations.Operation})
member.returns: A list of returned by the script.

member.name: M:telegen.Operations.Operation.ToString
member.summary: Returns a JSON-formatted that represents this instance.

member.name: T:telegen.Util.CommandParser
member.summary:
A parser class that I wrote a few years ago to parse application command lines in a consistent manner. I made only minimal tweaks to this class to get it ready for use here.
While designed for command line parsing, I was also able to coerce the class into doing double-duty as the line-level parser for the script engine.

remarks.para:
The parser follows these conventions:
Quoted strings (single or double) are handled as one token. The quotes are removed from the string.
The backslash ("\") character is the escape character.
Windows-formatted paths must use double-backslashes. Mac/Unix paths are acceptable as they are.
The switch prefix is two dashes ("--").
Switchs may have an optional value assigned like so: --switch=value
If a switch is assigned no value (--switch), then the assigned value is true.

member.name: P:telegen.Util.ReportLayout.Header
member.summary: Gets or sets the header data, in the format Header.<propertyName> = "Column Name";

member.name: P:telegen.Util.ReportLayout.HeaderFields
member.summary: Gets the header fields. Provides enumerable access to all of the column names in the dynamic object.

member.name: P:telegen.Util.ReportLayout.Layout
member.summary:
Gets or sets the layout. Report properties are placed in the layout by surrounding the property name with braces:
{propertyName1}, {propertyName2}...

member.name: P:telegen.Util.ReportLayout.KeepCrLfs
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether line breaks in the layout are significant. If this value is false, then line breaks are removed from the layout string before it is applied.
member.value: true if line breaks are significant; otherwise, false.
